title: Add AI image generation + promo creator to MeTube AI Studios and add YouTubeMe.co companion entry point

requirements.text: Extend the existing "MeTube AI Studios" area to include a new image workflow that lets authenticated users (a) upload their own picture, (b) generate a new image for free by describing what they want in a text prompt, and (c) create a simple promo image based on an uploaded picture by adding/removing basic visual elements (e.g., overlays, stickers/shapes, text headline/subheadline, and a simple background remove / subject cutout effect). All user-facing text must be in English.

acceptanceCriteria: When an authenticated user opens MeTube AI Studios, they can access an Images/Pictures section without leaving the AI Studios area (e.g., tabbed UI or clearly separated cards/sections).

The Images/Pictures section includes: (1) a local file picker to upload an image, (2) a text prompt input to generate an image for free, and (3) a promo creator UI that can place text overlays and simple graphic elements on top of the uploaded image.
The promo creator provides at least one "remove" capability that is fully on-device (no external AI calls), such as background removal using a simple heuristic or a manual erase/brush mask tool.
The user can export/download the final promo image as a PNG from the browser.
If the user is not logged in, the AI Studios page continues to show a clear login-required message (in English) for generation features, consistent with the existing AI Studios gating behavior.

requirements.text: Implement the AI image generation and promo editing logic entirely on the client (no external AI services): use a deterministic, on-device approach (e.g., Canvas-based rendering with prompt-driven templates/styles and lightweight heuristics) to produce a generated image result, and ensure the generated/promo output can be previewed before exporting.

quotes: generated image for free tell the ai what you want

acceptanceCriteria: Entering a prompt and clicking "Generate Image" produces a new preview image (not just text) generated client-side and renders it in the UI.
The generated image output supports at least 2 style variants selectable by the user (e.g., "Poster", "Gradient", "Minimal"), implemented locally.
No network calls to third-party AI APIs are made as part of image generation or promo editing (all computation is local).
The UI clearly shows loading/progress states during image generation and disables actions while generating.

requirements.text: Add optional backend persistence for user-created image projects inside MeTube AI Studios: allow authenticated users to save and later reopen their generated images/promo exports as a personal library (list, view, delete). Enforce that only the owner (or admin) can access/delete their saved images.
acceptanceCriteria: A signed-in user can save a generated/promo image to their library and see it listed after a refresh/reload.
A signed-in user can delete an image they own and it disappears from the library list after mutation completion.
A different signed-in user cannot access another userâ€™s saved image entries via backend API (must return an authorization error or null response).
Backend storage uses the existing single-actor Motoko backend and the existing blob-storage capability already present in the project (no new services).

requirements.text: Add a "YouTubeMe.co" companion entry point that is connected to MeTube: add a small, clearly labeled navigation/CTA in the UI (e.g., in the footer and/or Discover page) that routes users to an in-app informational page describing "YouTubeMe.co" as a connected YouTube-like companion experience, and (optionally) links out to https://YouTubeMe.co if provided as an external destination.

acceptanceCriteria: The app includes a visible UI entry point labeled "YouTubeMe.co" that users can find without opening dev tools (e.g., footer link and a Discover card).
Clicking the entry point opens an in-app page/section that explains in English what YouTubeMe.co is and how it relates to metube.xyz.
If an external link to YouTubeMe.co is shown, it opens in a new tab and does not break existing routing within the SPA.

constraints: Respect the existing single-actor Motoko backend architecture (all new backend logic must live in backend/main.mo).
Create backend/migration.mo only if required for upgrading existing stable state (conditional migration policy).
Do not edit files under frontend/src/components/ui or any paths listed in frontend.immutablePaths.
Do not use external AI APIs or third-party AI services for image generation/editing; implement on-device logic only.
Use English for any user-facing text.
nonGoals: Building and deploying a separate standalone frontend application for the YouTubeMe.co domain (this request only adds in-app connected entry points and an informational page).
Implementing advanced, cloud-scale AI image generation (e.g., diffusion models) or real-time collaboration features.
Adding new authentication providers (Internet Identity remains the only auth mechanism).
